text: Eduardo VII Park () is a public park in Lisbon, Portugal. The park have an area of , it is north of Avenida da Liberdade and Marquis of Pombal Square in Lisbon's city center. The park is named after King Edward VII of the United Kingdom, who visited Portugal in 1903. Until Edward's visit the park was called Parque da Liberdade (Liberty Park). In 1945 Portuguese Modernist architect Francisco Keil do Amaral redesigned the park to its current look. == References == Category:Parks in Europe Category:Lisbon
title: Eduardo VII Park
